metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5137 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A legacy extension's non-contentaccessible, defined resources can be loadedby an arbitrary web page through script. This script does this by using amaliciously crafted path string to reference the resources. Note: thisvulnerability does not affect WebExtensions. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
